description.narrative: The grant will focus on small livestock development and vocational training. For the 1st yearthe Centre will give women vocational training in agriculture: mushroom, small livestock and poultry production through two to three and nine month courses. 2nd year: practical work in small livestock production will be undertaken. Day-old chicks and young pigs will be acquired. An incubator/hatchery will be purchased to enable the Centre to start the production of day-old chicks both for sale and for fattening at the Centre. Five wooden pens to house nine pigs will be built. By the end of the second year, piglets, chicks and fertile eggs will be available for sale.In the final year of funding, feed ration formulation, using locally available ingredients will be emphasized. To ensure sustainability, the balanced feed produced will be used to feed the animals at the Centre and will be sold to livestock producers, thereby raising revenue to continue project activities following the final year of funding

participating-org.narrative: Ntankah Village Women Common Initiative Group
